name: hyphen
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
B2 the symbol -, used to join two words together, or to show that a word has been divided into two parts at the end of one line and the beginning of the next: There are hyphens in "well-to-do". Compare
dash noun (PUNCTUATION)
More examplesFewer examplesWhere should I put the hyphen to break the word 'authority'?There is a hyphen between the two names.

Grammar
HyphensHyphens are a form of dash (-) which we use between words or parts of words. …
Add to word list
Add to word list
the mark (-) used in writing to join two words together, or between the syllables of a word when it is divided at the end of a line of text hyphenate verb [ T ] us
Your browser doesn't support HTML5 audio
/ˈhɑɪ·fəˌneɪt/
She hyphenates her first name, Anne-Marie.
